intro: Pennellia juncea, commonly known as the common pennellia, is a flowering plant species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Pennellia juncea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields.
